NET REVENUE LOSSES CALCULATION METHODOLOGY Wind and Solar Net Revenue Losses:
Net Revenue Loss payments (NRL Payments) during any period of time for which they are required hereunder (the NRL Period) shall equal the sum of:
(a) the product of (i) the MWh of electricity that would have been produced based on the actual wind or solar measurements, as applicable, during the NRL Period, and (ii) the price such electricity would have been sold and delivered by the Co-Tenant receiving such NRL Payment (the Receiving Co-Tenant) under such Co-Tenants power purchase agreement had the electricity been produced, or if such Co-Tenant has no power purchase agreement, then at the Commodity Reference Price for electricity during such NRL Period,
(b) if the Co-Tenant is eligible to receive the federal production tax credits (PTCs) pursuant to 26 U.S.C. §45, the dollar value for the PTCs that would have been payable to the Co-Tenant receiving such NRL Payments during the NRL Period, grossed up on an after-tax basis assuming the highest marginal federal and State of Illinois income tax rates then in effect (and no local foreign or other income taxes),
(c) if the Co-Tenant is eligible to receive renewable energy credits, including those granted pursuant to law, regulation, certification, markets, trading, off-set, private transaction, renewable portfolio standards, voluntary programs, (RECs) and such Co-Tenant is not otherwise compensated for RECs as part of subsection (a) above, then the Co-Tenant obligated to make the NRL Payment (the Paying Co-Tenant) shall either (at the Paying Co-Tenants option) (i) pay to the Receiving Co-Tenant, the dollar value for the RECs that would have been payable to the Co-Tenant receiving such NRL Payments based on the average price per MWh of RECs of two valid seller price quotes for lots of not less than 5,000 MWhs of comparable RECs from nationally recognized REC Brokers or (ii) transfer or cause to be transferred to the Co-Tenant losing such RECs replacement RECs of equal volume, technology type, state and vintage of the RECs being lost to replace the lost RECs (in either case, the REC Payment), and
(d) any penalties or liquidated damages assessed against such Co-Tenant for failing to produce electricity such Co-Tenant was contractually obligated to produce, including any costs or penalties assessed by PJM.
The term Commodity Reference Price means the real-rime locational marginal price at PJMs pricing node for each 5-minute interval for the Projects which will be established upon interconnection of the Projects during the NRL Period or any successor PJM pricing market that reports prices applicable during the NRL Period at the affected Partys pricing node for all intervals during such NRL Period.
Storage Net Revenue Losses:
NRL Payments during any NRL Period for a Party with respect to storage shall equal the sum of:
(a) the product of (i) the average hourly regulation compensation received by the Party incurring the Net Revenue Losses over the most recent 7-day period preceding the NRL Period, and (ii) the duration of the NRL Period in hours,
(b) if the Co-Tenant is eligible to receive PTCs pursuant to the Inflation Reduction Act, the dollar value for the PTCs that would have been payable to the Co-Tenant receiving such NRL Payments during the NRL Period, grossed up on an after-tax basis assuming the highest marginal federal and State of Illinois income tax rates then in effect (and no local foreign or other income taxes),
(c) any reduction in payments under the Power Purchase Agreement for the Party incurring the Net Revenue Losses, and
(d) any other ancillary service revenues, energy arbitrage margin, or capacity market revenues lost due to the occurrence of an NRL Period.
A reimbursing Party shall pay any and all Net Revenue Losses for which reimbursement is required under any provision of this Agreement to the applicable Co-Tenant owner within thirty (30) days of receipt of the calculation of Net Revenue Losses from such Co-Tenant owner.
- Exhibit F-i - EXHIBIT G Attached to and made a part of the Assignment, Co-Tenancy, and Shared Facilities Agreement METERING AGREEMENT Metering Agreement to be agreed upon by the parties in writing within thirty (30) days following written request from any of IGW or HPS, each of which may make its own separate request.
